aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: defaultAdminShell
A list of quality tasks (qTask).
Property for the list of quality tasks.

A quality task (qTask) defines why data is exchanged between 2 or more companies and what insights should be generated out of the transferred data. In addition there is a flag, what happens with the transferred data when this qTask is closed

The record operation enumeration can be used to realize delta update concept. Delta update concept means: - You transfer an initial load of data - After the first week only the delta to the initial load is transferred
The record status describes whether this record is: - new=>This record is transferred the first time - update=> Some properties of this record have changed compared to a previous transfer - delete=> This record was transferred in the initial load or in a previous delta update, but is not used any more and therefore it should be deleted on data consumer side - same=> This record was transferred in the initial load or in a previous delta update
Timestamp when this qTask was created
The component that should be investigated in this qTask.
What should be done with the data after this qTask is closed
Description what should be done in this qTask
A unique quality task identifier within the Catena-X dataspace. The unique id uses the Catena-X UUID trait.
Status of this quality task
Working title for this qTask
A list of companies involved in this quality task
One company involved in this qTask
The Catena-X business partner number for this company.
Name of the company
An email address.

This entity groups all meta information properties. Meta information properties give hints for a Catena-X data consumer to better understand, how this data set was created on the Catena-X data provider side.
Describes the selection criteria a Catena-X data provider has applied to create this data set.
Describes the starting point for providing records in this data set.
Describes the end point for providing records in this data set.
A list of quality tasks (qTask).
